course_main_structural_unit.address:
Riia 23-204; Riia 23b-226,230,234
51010 Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

description.en: The course of developmental biology deals with processes occurring during the embryonic and post-embryonic development of animals. First part of the lectures and practical works focus at first on the development of male and female germ cells (gametogenesis) and then on the processes of fertilization, cleavage and gastrulation stage (early development). Second part of the course concentrates to the development of germ layers (ectoderm, mesoderm, endoderm) and their derivatives and organogenesis (organ`s formation).
description.et: Arengubioloogia kursusel käsitletakse loomade embrüonaalse ja postembrüonaalse arengu käigus toimuvaid protsesse. Loengud ja praktikumid on ülesehitatud arengu loomulikku kulgu järgides. Esmalt keskendutakse isas- ja emassugurakkude arengule (spermatogenees ja oogenees) ja seejärel vastavalt viljastumise, lõigustumise ja gastrulatsiooni protsessidele (varane areng). Kursuse teises osas vaadeldakse gastrulatsiooni käigus tekkinud lootelehtede (ektoderm, mesoderm, endoderm) kujunemist vastavateks organiteks (organogeneesid).

objectives.en: The aim of the course is to provide general knowledge on the life-cycle of
objectives.et: Arengubioloogia kursuse eesmärk on anda üldteadmised organismide elutsüklist, põhirõhk on varase

objectives.en: organisms, with major focus on the principles and regulation of early development.

learning_outcomes.en: The student who passed the course:
1) Orientates in terminology of developmental biology, understands the principle processes of development, and is able to understand molecular mechanisms of these processes in different animals.
learning_outcomes.et: 1) Orienteerub arengubioloogia terminoloogias, saab aru arengulistest põhiprotsessidest ning oskab luua seoseid erinevate arenguprotsesside/mehhanismide vahel ning võrrelda erinevaid loomarühme arengubioloogilises kontekstis

learning_outcomes.en: 2) Is competent in describing the stem cells, sex determination, early developmental stages, such as fertilization, cleavage, gastrulation, and understands the processes occurring/taking place during these stages.
learning_outcomes.et: 2) Oskab kirjeldada varaseid arenguetappe nagu viljastumine, lõigustumine ja gastrulatsioon ning nendes etappides toimuvaid protsesse

learning_outcomes.en: 3) Understands the formation process of germ layers and how they give a particular shape to different tissues, organs, organ systems.
learning_outcomes.et: 3) Oskab kirjeldada kuidas tekivad lootelehed ja kuidas neist formeeruvad erinevad koed ja organid/organsüsteemid

learning_outcomes.en: 4) Can understand scientific articles related to developmental biology at a good level.
learning_outcomes.et: 4) Oskab kirjeldada nii emas- kui isassugurakkude arengut ning soo determinatsiooni

learning_outcomes.en: 5) Is capable of working with microscope and can analyze the samples seen in microscope.
learning_outcomes.et: 5) Oskab töötada mikroskoobiga ja mikroskoobis nähtut analüüsida ning üles tähendada

grade_preconditions.et:
The student needs to register for the exam in ÕIS.

(Tudeng peab eksamile regitreeruma.)

Course attendance including seminars (students presentations according to the topics of the course) and practical works (knowledge of preparations and the assertion of practice note-book)

grade_evaluation.et: Mark of the course (A, B, C, D, E, F system) forms of summarized points (max 12 points) of the practical work (max 3 points) and written exam on the basis of lectures and seminars (max 9 points).

debt_elimination.et: Repeat exam can be done in accordance with the UT Study Regulations

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)
